author: TravisEz13
body: We should only have one opt-out mechanism.  We should remove the file opt-out as it is not flexible enough for all situations.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: I agree that we should only have one way to opt-out. If .NET Core uses the environment variable only, then we should do the same.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
I agree - we should not litter the home folder.

I'd also cosider Enterprises - I believe they want use GPO for Windows. Most MSFT products have such registry keys to turn on/off telemetry.

comments.author: thezim
iSazonov
SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Let's be clear that any new telemetry will likely be opt-in and be described in a RFC.  The current basic startup telemetry we have now helps provide data of PSCore6 adoption and determines if we increase or decrease our investments.  Since we ship packages outside of GitHub, we can't just track download numbers (which are unreliable anyways).

title: remove file opt-out from telemetery and only use environment variable
